info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 3:22PM CDT until further notice by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Illinois, including the following counties, Fayette and Marion. * WHEN...Until 630 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 322 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vandalia, St. Elmo, Kinmundy, Brownstown, Mulberry Grove, Patoka, Farina, Shobonier, Stephen Forbes Station, Avena, La Clede, Pittsburg, Shafter, St. Peter, Alma, Vernon, St. Paul, Loogootee, St. James and Hagerstown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
